content.description:
This route starts at the very right of the wall, and traverses left to topout at the same flake seen on the "

High Flake

" route.  It is a very fun and fairly long problem with some interesting beta to be chosen.  This is a classic Flagstaff traverse.

Start on the good, slopey holds just below and right of the flake at

High Flake

, and move up to a sloping edge. Match the sloping edge and then bump out right to a good pebble. Then using a high and fragile left hand crimp and a high right foot, rock over the lip and top out pretty high on the dirty slab. The movement on this one is a ton of fun, but the rock quality up high is not that good, and it can be a little dicey up towards the top.
content.location:
This is just right of

High Flake

, in the middle of the wall, and just left of the

Center Line

(V1/2).

content.description:
Directly to the right of "

Kaptain Face

", there is a problem that climbs the thin seam which turns into a small chimney.  Many small edges and laybacks are present.  This is a fun Flagstaff problem.
content.protection: A crashpad is necessesary unless you intend on flashing.

content.description:
This problem climbs the obvious red streak between Round Pebble and the flake that marks the end of the Three of a Kind Traverse. Start from the large chalked flake and follow the line of small crimps up and slightly left to the end of the red streak. Then move slightly right on pebbles to the top out.

A variation to this problem starts by moving with your left hand to the crimp in the middle of the red streak followed by a reach out right to a crimp up and slightly left of the finishing flake on the traverse and another move back into the original problem. Those of us with weak fingers will likely find this variation easier.
content.location: This problem is between Round Pebble and the end of the Three of a Kind Traverse starting on an obvious chalked flake at headish height.

content.description: This is a really fun scramble on the right side of the wall. Climb over a small hump down low and then head up to the top on good holds.
content.location:
This is on the right side of the wall, left of

Center Line

, right of the big groove.

content.description:
This route is directly left of "

The Face

" and starts on another thin face with climbable holds on it.  Goes straight up on solid but small holds.
content.protection: A crashpad.  Many nasty rocks on this landing.

content.description:
Just to the right of the prominent groove that contains "

Round Pebble

," there is a large flake extending up and to the left.  Climb this flake and then reach up to a small crystal for the topout.
A fun but easy problem starting to the right of "High Flake".  It follows the obvious groove in the rock for an easy topout
This route is located at the leftmost part of the Three of a Kind Wall.  This is a soft and pretty good quality sandstone face.  Route goes straight up to the top, but beware of loose flakes.
content.protection: A crashpad and someone to make sure you don't hit the tree if you fall.

content.description: Start on a jug, and either make a huge move up to a good edge or figure something else out to get up in the seam. Then work up the seam using some pebble pinching technique and top out up high on a slab.
content.location:
Just right of the

Slippery Slope

and left of the

Ledge System

scramble. It is on the right side of the wall, 15 feet left of the obvious groove.

content.description: This route is located at the far right of the Three of a Kind Wall.  To begin, start at the sloping travers that leads to a thin crack in the middle of the slab.  This route climbs up the sloping slab for a fun finish.
